channel.title: Ushome | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - all the latest US news, showbiz, science, sport and health stories from the Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Colorado theater gunman James Holmes AVOIDS death sentence and jailed for life
item.description: Jurors in Arapahoe County, Colorado, failed to reach a unanimous verdict on whether Holmes deserved capital punishment or not - meaning that he will spend life in prison instead.
item.media:description: James Holmes sits in court for an advisement hearing at the Arapahoe County Justice Center in Centennial, Colorado, in this file photo taken June 4, 2013. Jurors in the Colorado cinema massacre trial were deliberating on Friday whether gunman Holmes should be put to death for killing 12 people and wounding 70 three years ago inside a packed midnight screening of a Batman film. REUTERS/Andy Cross/Pool/Files

item.title: Woman, 28, arrested for viciously stabbing her 84-year-old NEIGHBOR to death after breaking into her house
item.description: Las Vegas police have arrested a woman in the stabbing death of an 84-year-old woman in late July. Margarita Balandova, 28, of Las Vegas was arrested Thursday and charged with murder.

item.title: The creditors spitting mad that Sarah Ferguson's moving to tax haven Switzerland
item.description: In January, Andrew and Fergie, who divorced 19 years ago, jointly put their names to the title deeds of a £13 million chalet in that most chi-chi of Swiss ski resorts, Verbier.

item.title: Santeria priest 'used HEALING ritual as cover to sexually abuse on girl, 16'
item.description: Pablo Pinto Mata, a 46-year-old cleric of the Santeria religion, is accused of the sex attack against the minor, in Montebello, California, where police say he forced her to undress for him.

item.title: Bobbi Kristina Brown’s boyfriend Nick Gordon 'fed her drugs in the bath'
item.description: The suit, filed on Friday, is the latest step prosecutors have made since filing a 'wrongful death' case against Gordon in June, accusing him of assault, battery, and stealing Brown's money.

item.title: California child who visited Yosemite has come down with the plague
item.description: The child became ill and was hospitalized with the disease, after visiting the Stanislaus National Forest then camping at Yosemite's Crane Flat campground last month, officials said.

item.title: President Obama flies to Martha's Vineyard a day early with Michelle and Sasha
item.description: It seems Obama couldn't wait to return to his favorite vacation spot, Martha's Vineyard in Massachusetts, as he last-minute decided to fly on Friday afternoon, instead of Saturday as planned.

item.title: Todd Courser 'planted story about having sex with gay prostitute' to cover up affair
item.description: Todd Courser, 43, a freshman Republican in the Michigan House, was heard on an audio recording telling aide Benjamin Graham to send out a fake story saying he had sex with a prostitute.

item.title: Philadelphia service dog Yolanda calls 911 during fire and saves blind owner's life
item.description: A golden retriever named Yolanda warned authorities about the house fire on Thursday morning at her home in the Holmesburg section of Philadelphia. She called on a special phone and firefighters responded.

item.title: Kevin Ward Jr's parents sue NASCAR's Tony Stewart over fatal crash
item.description: Kevin Ward Jr's parents, Kevin and Pamela Ward filed the lawsuit in the 5th Judicial District for the Supreme Court of the State of New York in Lowville.

item.title: Hospital appeals for specialist equipment to transport a 768 pound morbidly obese man who has been bedridden for a month
item.description: James King, 45, who weighs 768 pounds, has been stuck in a room at Baptist Health in Paducah for almost one month. The hospital says it does not have the resources to keep on caring for him.

item.title: Connecticut woman killed by Metro North express train while getting item on track
item.description: The unidentified woman, 28, was struck on Friday around 9.30am at the Cos Cob station in Greenwich, a Metro-North Railroad spokeswoman says.

item.title: How the one-per-centers live: Michael Moore is selling his seven-bedroomed Michigan lake log-palace mansion for $5 million after being banned from living there after his 2013 divorce
item.description: Filmmaker Michael Moore’s former vacation home in the Traverse City area is up for sale. The home on Torch Lake in northern Michigan is on the market for $5.2 million.

item.title: David and Ornella Steiner who died in New Mexico desert likely saved son giving him their water
item.description: David Steiner, 42, and his wife, Ornella Steiner, 51 died during an afternoon hike across the searing New Mexico desert. They were tourists from the small town of Bourgogne, France.

item.title: How Indiana 911 dispatcher REFUSED to send ambulance for a caller
item.description: The incident in Gary, Indiana, is the latest in a growing number of cases across the United States where dispatchers have refused to help citizens in an emergency.

item.title: How washing your hands does ward off colds
item.description: The spread of colds and other viruses could be slowed and winter pressures on the NHS reduced if people are encouraged to wash their hands more frequently, researchers say.

item.title: Taliban suicide bomber strikes Afghan police academy in Kabul
item.description: The bomber, who was wearing a police uniform, detonated his explosives in the centre of a crowd of students, killing at least 20 recruits and wounding 24 others, Afghan officials said.

item.title: Donald Trump is most-searched candidate in first GOP debate on Google
item.description: Trump was the most-searched candidate on Google during the prime-time bash-fest He was also the most-mentioned candidate on Facebook and Twitter.

item.title: Nicki Minaj visits Zion Harvey, eight-year-old who received a double hand transplant
item.description: Zion Harvey lost both of his hands and feet at the age of two from a gangrene infection. Minaj visited him and other patients at the Children's Hospital of Philadelphia earlier this week.

item.title: Science Advances reveals our eye shape helped turn humans into hunters
item.description: A study found humans became successful hunters (file photo) because our eyes have circular pupils, as opposed to the elongated horizontal ones of plant-eating animals such as sheep.

item.title: Chinese hackers target American Airlines and travel reservation company Sabre
item.description: Sabre Corp, a Texas-based company that provides technology used for airline and hotel reservations, confirmed hack but isn't sure if any data was stolen.

item.title: Django Unchained actress Daniele Watts ordered to rewrite apology letter to LAPD
item.description: Daniele Watts' first note merely apologized to the police officer for disturbing 'your carefree coffee break' and thanked him for giving her the opportunity to shine a light on racial profiling.

item.title: Ohio man accused of setting fiancée on fire says it was an 'accident'
item.description: Michael Slager, 40, allegedly set Judith Malinowski, 31, ablaze behind a Speedway gas station in Gahanna, Ohio, on Sunday, at 5.pm. The incident left Malinowski hospitalized.

item.title: Meredith Vieira is revamping her talk show to look more like The View
item.description: Meredith Vieira is retooling her daytime show amid reports that the NBC-produced show was in trouble. Author Katherine Schwarzenegger, daughter of Maria Shriver, tried out.

item.title: The more offensive Donald Trump is, the more Americans want to vote for him, RICHARD LITTLEJOHN says
item.description: Donald Trump is known as the Teflon Don because nothing sticks to him - no matter how outrageous -and every time he makes a gaffe, his ratings soar, writes RICHARD LITTLEJOHN.

item.title: Speech clinics help transgender patients find their voices
item.description: The University of Connecticut's Speech and Hearing Clinic is one of a growing number of clinics with programs.

item.title: Slicing a bagel along the 'Mobius Strip' is best way to add more filling
item.description: A video shows how to cut a bagel into a Möbius strip, which a famous mathematical structure that only has one side, providing more surface area to spread cream cheese.

item.title: Telling a person they're fat makes them even fatter
item.description: Psychologists found that believing you are overweight is counter productive – highlighting a problem for doctors trying to combat the obesity epidemic.

item.title: Ariana Grande debuts her first fragrance with a perfume ad
item.description: The 22-year-old's first scent, Ari by Ariana Grande, hits stores in September. It includes notes of fruits, florals, and marshmallow. A campaign image starring the singer was released today.

item.title: 12,000 lbs of cocaine seized by the California Coast Guard pictured
item.description: The stash, seized 200 miles south of Mexico, is estimated to be worth $181 million - and that doesn't include another 4,000 pounds of cocaine lost when Coast Guard attempted to tow the boat.

item.title: Vogue editor Anna Wintour gives Glamour staffers advice at annual editorial meeting
item.description: Well-known perfectionist and Vogue editor-in-chief Anna Wintour, 65, surprised Glamour editors during the Conde Nast annual editorial meeting by telling staffers that 'imperfection is fine.'

item.title: Peeps' autumn-inspired marshmallow candies put to the test
item.description: Peeps is debuting pumpkin spice, candy corn, and caramel apple flavors this September - just in time for fall. The beloved treats will be sold exclusively at Target and the brand's online store.

item.title: Carly Fiorina scores big in second-tier Cleveland debate
item.description: She's one of a handful of Republicans with buzz-driven momentum following Thursday's Cleveland event. She sought to capitalize on it at a conservative gathering today.

item.title: Princess Beatrice joins Oprah Winfrey on mega-yacht off Ibiza coast
item.description: The 26-year-old was seen with her boyfriend Dave Clark on the Chelsea owner's luxury boat - once the world's largest superyacht - which was docked off the Spanish coast.

item.title: Mars salt flats could be last place water survived on the red planet
item.description: Researchers have discovered evidence of an ancient lake that likely represents some of the last potentially habitable surface water ever to exist on the Red Planet.
item.media:description:
Salt flat indicates some of the last vestiges of surface water on Mars, CU-Boulder study finds -
Mars turned cold and dry long ago, but researchers at the University of Colorado Boulder have discovered evidence of an ancient lake that likely represents some of the last potentially habitable surface water ever to exist on the Red Planet.
The study, published Thursday in the journal Geology, examined an 18-square-mile chloride salt deposit (roughly the size of the city of Boulder) in the planet?s Meridiani region near the Mars Opportunity rover?s landing site. As seen on Earth in locations such as Utah?s Bonneville Salt Flats, large-scale salt deposits are considered to be evidence of evaporated bodies of water.
Digital terrain mapping and mineralogical analysis of the features surrounding the deposit indicate that this one-time lakebed is no older than 3.6 billion years old, well after the time period when Mars is thought to have been warm enough to sustain large amounts of surface

item.title: Android flaw 'Certifi-gate' lets hackers listen in on conversations and steal data
item.description: The flaw could allow hackers to 'steal personal data, track device locations, turn on microphones to record conversations', the firm that discovered it says.
item.media:description:
A hacker with a laptop.
D99KXY

item.title: Kim Kardashian impersonator Setareh Khatibi shows how to master the pout
item.description: Setareh Khatibi, who is known as Silly Sitara on YouTube, shows how to get Kim Kardashian's full lip-look using make-up while using the mannerisms and voice of the reality star.

item.title: Apple spends $700k-a-year on security for CEO Tim Cook
item.description: Apple said the huge sum was for 'home and personal security' for Cook, but the huge sum is still less than half of the $1.6million that Amazon reportedly spends per year protecting Jeff Bezos.
item.media:description:
Timothy Cook, CEO of Apple, delivers opening remarks while testifying before the Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs Committee's Investigations Subcommittee about the company's offshore profit shifting and tax avoidance in the Dirksen Senate Office Building on Capitol Hill in Washington, DC.
A Congressional report released yesterday said that Apple, America's most profitable technology company, used a complex system of international subsidiaries and tax avoidance efforts to shift at least $74 billion out of the reach of the Internal Revenue Service between 2009 and 2012. (Photo by Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images) *** BESTPIX *** WASHINGTON, DC - MAY 21:

item.title: Couple's 1st dance begins to Justin Timberlake before busting out 6-minute routine
item.description: Hollie and Dave Smith shunned the traditional slow, romantic first dance in favour of an all-singing, all-dancing routine, which the British couple choreographed for their special day.

item.title: Kim Kardashian and Kanye West's new baby boy's name will be Easton
item.description: Kim has said that the name for Baby No. 2 will be 'directionless.' But a family friend has spilled the beans to Daily Mail Online about the moniker of the baby boy due at the end of the year.

item.title: Paraplegic Emma Carey overcame disability and is now a fitness role model
item.description: Diagnosed as a paraplegic by her doctors in Switzerland after a freak skydiving accident, Australian Emma Carey amazed everyone when she got back on her feet just one year later.

item.title: Cindy Crawford's husband Rande Gerber gives a glimpse inside family's fridge
item.description: Cindy Crawford and Rande Gerber have 14 mouths to feed as they host guests during their lakeside vacation in Canada this week.

item.title: Cat owner hacks automatic feeder to satisfy pet's hunting instincts
item.description: Benjamin Millam has released a video of his cat 'hunting' RFID enabled balls which, when delivered to a specially built automatic feeding machine, allow the cat to get its reward for the hunt.

item.title: Courtney Jording and mother Karen 'shot up heroin in car with baby girl in back seat'
item.description: Courtney Jording, 23, was allegedly spotted injecting her mother, 43-year-old Karen Gillespie, with the Schedule I drug as they sat inside a car at a Sheetz gas station in Greensburg, Pennsylvania.

item.title: Texas boy dies after being found locked in hot car outside of Waffle House
item.description: A four-month-old boy has died after being found left alone inside of a hot car outside of a Waffle House in Texas. Employees found him unconscious in a white Sebring with the windows rolled up.

item.title: Texas judge orders Josten Bundy to marry his girlfriend or serve jail sentence
item.description: Josten Bundy, 20, appeared before Judge Randall Rogers in a Texas court to face an assault charge after fighting with Elizabeth Jaynes' ex-boyfriend. He agreed to marry her within 30 days in lieu of jail time.

item.title: weatherView shows Typhoon Soudelor hitting land via an interactive map
item.description: Named weatherView, the map allows you to switch on various layers showing the planet’s temperature, precipitation, moisture and pressure, as well as see the world's air currents in detail.

item.title: Aldon Smith cut from San Francisco 49ers after arrest for DUI in Santa Clara
item.description: The 25-year-old linebacker was booked into Santa Clara County Jail on charges of hit-and-run, drunken driving and vandalism on Thursday before posting $26,000 bail on Friday and leaving.

item.title: Photographer Ivette Ivens documents her baby and French bulldog
item.description: Photographer Ivette Ivens, originally from Lithuania but now living in Chicago, has documented the 'out-of-control cuteness' of her son Dilan and their pet puppy Farley, who were born on the same day.

item.title: McDonald's tests create-your-own gourmet burger menu in New York City
item.description: The 'Create Your Taste' menu allows customers to customize their own burger with from choice of artisinal bun to toppings like bacon, guacamole and tortilla strips.
item.media:description:
At a popular Midtown lunch spot, mystified customers tap away at sleek touchscreens, selecting ?guacamole? or ?red onion? from an array of options.
The restaurant happens to be a McDonald?s at the corner of 58th Street and Third Avenue, and the general consensus appears to be: ?What the Hamburglar is going on?? As part of a new pilot menu called Create Your Taste, Mickey D?s is encouraging customers to play chef, choosing from a long list of unusual ingredients to build a better burger. (Apparently millennials have been fleeing McDonald?s in droves, instead getting their pricey kicks at Pret A Manger and the Whole Foods salad bar.)

item.title: Boston woman killed when after she was hit by tractor-trailer
item.description: Police are searching for the driver of a tractor-trailer who ran into a cyclist in her 20s at an intersection Friday morning and then continued after possibly not noticing what had happened.

item.title: Texan police chief is tasered by junior officer after losing Facebook bet
item.description: Derek Dyson of Danbury Police Department, Texas, had claimed his force couldn't get 1,600 Facbook likes as the town only had 1,600 residents. But as word of the bet spread, the target was reached.

item.title: The Gardner Museum robbers are dead, FBI reveals
item.description: The shocking revelation comes just one day after the FBI released a new video showing an unidentified man being let into the Boston museum 24 hours before the heist.

item.title: Two Georgia women arrested 'for keeping special needs siblings in cages
item.description: Stephanie Stone (pictured), 34, and Wanda Redfern, 49, of Georgia, have been charged with cruelty to children and false imprisonment after officers found Stone's 11-year-old son caged.

item.title: Florida brothers Elias and D.C. Goutoufas hear each other for the first time
item.description: Elias and D.C. Goutoufas, who are from Tampa, Florida, have been deaf all their lives due to a congenital defect. The moment they heard each other for the first time was captured on video.

item.title: Demi Lovato joins 'Unwrap My Cosmo' campaign as retailers hide Cosmopolitan mag
item.description: Demi, who appears on the cover of the latest issue of Cosmopolitan, wrote an impassioned message on Instagram. The 22-year-old included the anti-censorship hashtag #UnwrapMyCosmo.

item.title: Three Greensboro teens charged with murdering 74-year-old Larry Brown
item.description: Larry Brown's body was found by police in Greenbriar Road (pictured) in Greensboro, North Carolina, on July 29 having suffered a 'significant' head injury while walking to a bus stop.

item.title: Baby Rizwan Ahmad found dead in NYC courtyard after being thrown from window
item.description: One-month-old Rizwan Ahmad was found lying on the ground in a onesie, covered in blood from head injuries, outside 85-55 115th Street in Queens, New York Friday morning.
item.media:description:
Police are investigating whether he fell, was tossed from a window or was left there, but sources familiar with the investigation tell the New York Post it appeared the child was thrown.
It's unclear at this time whether the newborn was alive in the courtyard before dying.
Police took a half-dozen family members in for questioning, including the child's 21-year-old mother, but so far no arrests have been made.
The medical examiner will determine the cause of death.
Neighbor Mazoo Illyayeva, 20, told the Post she was the one who found baby Rizwan lying on the ground covered in blood.
'I stepped outside for some fresh air,? she recalled. ?As soon as I closed the door I heard a little thud like a book thrown through the window and for some reason something told me to go downstairs.
After making the shocking discovery, which she said was like 'seeing a dead puppy laying in the street,' the horrified woman called 911.
Illyayeva said she later witnessed police leading six adults from

item.title: UFC fighter Ronda Rousey shows off bikini body in Rio de Janeiro
item.description: The 28-year-old has been touring Rio de Janeiro with her family throughout this week after successfully defending her title against Bethe Correia in Brazil on Saturday night.

item.title: Utah police believe Kailey Vijil WAS sexually assaulted
item.description: A 15-year-old boy has been arrested for the murder of Kailey Vijil, 12, who was found naked in a field in July, but so far he has not been charged with sexual assault.
item.media:description:
West Valley teen lured away then killed 12-year-old neighbor, police say
WEST VALLEY CITY ? West Valley police say a 15-year-old boy killed a 12-year-old neighbor, Kailey Vijil, early Friday and left her body in a horse pasture.
West Valley Police Chief Lee Russo said it appeared that there was no prior relationship between the two, yet the teen somehow was able to convince the young girl to walk outside her house at midnight and go with him.
"I believe a good-natured child was fooled and unfortunately made a mistake she paid the ultimate price for," Russo said. "This young girl thought she was helping somebody."
The chief said evidence was collected that linked the boy to the crime. Detectives were led to the teen based on information given to them by neighbors.
"He was known in the community, that's how we were able to develop these leads," he said.
Yellow police tape surrounded the boy's home, near 5000 West and 3400 South, where a search warrant was served Friday afternoon.

item.title: What happens to your body after eating bacon revealed in parody infographic
item.description: The Coke picture, which explains what happens to your body withing the first hour of drinking, recently went viral. Since then, people have been inspired to make similar graphics - with a comedic twist.

item.title: Drunken man on Delta Air Lines flight to Hawaii 'threatened to kill fliers'
item.description: Eric Matthew Schneider allegedly grew aggressive after consuming several rounds of alcoholic drinks while flying from Seattle, Washington state, to Maui, Hawaii, with his girlfriend on Monday.

item.title: Chuck Schumer says he will oppose President Barack Obama's Iran nuclear deal
item.description: The New York senator said in a statement on Thursday that there is a real risk that Iran will not moderate and will use the pact to pursue its nefarious goals.
item.media:description: NEW YORK, NY - AUGUST 03: U.S. Senator Chuck Schumer (D-NY) speaks at a press conference with Comedian Amy Schumer calling for tighter gun laws in an effort to stop mass shootings and gun violence on August 3, 2015 in New York City. A gunman killed two women last month in Louisiana during a showing of Schumer's movie "Trainwreck." (Photo by Andrew Burton/Getty Images)

item.title: My Big Fat Fabulous Life sees 380lb Whitney Thore finishing a 5k run
item.description: Whitney Thore, 30, from North Carolina, became famous in 2014 when a YouTube video of her dancing went viral, she is now giving a peek at the second season of her reality show.

item.title: Is this the most horrifying prank ever? Man is tricked into thinking his ‘blood-soaked’ friend has been killed by an axe murderer video
item.description: Norwegian prankster Tom should have expected retribution after waking his friend up with a roaring chainsaw - without a blade - (pictured) but friends Marius went above and beyond with this ruse.

item.title: Tolkien estate lawyers threaten Suffolk couple over hobbit hole campsite advert
item.description: Jan and Ed Lengyel, both 53, have been threatened with legal action by the Tolkien Estate over plans to build their luxury 'poddit hole' for Lord of the Rings fans at their Suffolk campsite.

item.title: Couple of 68 years reunited while both are patients in Piedmont Fayette Hospital
item.description: A hospital worker's actions brought a 96-year-old man to tears after she helped to reunite him with his beloved wife of 68 years. The couple was put in separate rooms at Piedmont Fayette Hospital.

item.title: Jenson Button and his wife being gassed by thieves doubted by French police
item.description: French police and medical experts have cast serious doubts over claims that Formula One driver Jenson Button and his wife Jessica were 'gassed' in their French villa as they slept while on holiday.

item.title: Mom praises UFC champion Ronda Rousey for revealing her childhood speech impediment
item.description: Laura Smith, from Denver, Colorado, took her five-year-old daughter, Ashlynn, who suffers from apraxia of speech, to meet the star in the hopes she would raise awareness for the disorder.

item.title: Do photos show Iran hiding nuclear weapons evidence at Parchin military complex?
item.description: A Washington think tank claims the pictures prove that Iran is 'sanitizing' the Parchin military complex, pictured, before nuclear weapons inspectors are allowed in under the terms of an international deal.

item.title: Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump pictured at his 2005 wedding to Melania
item.description: At Thursday night's Republican presidential debate, Donald Trump was called out for being too chummy with Democratic hopeful Hillary Clinton.
item.media:description:
SEE NOTES FOR FEE**
Caption:PALM BEACH, FL: Newlyweds Donald Trump Sr. and Melania Trump with Hillary Rodham Clinton and Bill Clinton at their reception held at The Mar-a-Lago Club in January 22, 2005 in Palm Beach, Florida. (Photo by Maring Photography/Getty Images/Contour by Getty Images)
item.media:credit: Maring Photography/Getty Images/Contour by Getty Images

item.title: The honeymoon crashers! Maid of honor Courteney Cox and more Hollywood pals join Jennifer Aniston and Justin Theroux on love boat in Bora Bora
item.description: The couple are seen here aboard their loveboat - along with a gaggle of their Hollywood pals, including Jen's former Friends co-star Courteney Cox, 51, who also served as her maid of honor.
item.media:description:
Picture Shows: Amanda Anka, Jason Bateman, Coco Arquette, Courteney Cox, Justin Theroux, Jennifer Aniston, Johnny McDaid August 07, 2015
 
 **MINIMUM WEB USAGE £500**
 
 Actress Jennifer Aniston and Justin Theroux start their honeymoon and brought along some of their closest friends for the trip in Bora Bora. 
 
 The couple wed in a ceremony at their Bel Air home on Wednesday night in front of 75 of their friends and family and apparently decided to keep the party rolling and brought some of them along for their honeymoon!

item.title: Yellowstone supervolcano eruption would cause 90k deaths and nuclear winter
item.description: If it were to erupt, the supervolcano could release a 10 ft (3-meter) layer of molten ash 1,000 miles (1,609km) from Yellowstone National Park, experts have warned.

item.title: Beverly Hills mansion with bullet-proof safe room on sale for $29million
item.description: This European-style mansion in Beverly Hills, California, could be yours - if you are willing to fork out a whopping $29million. It is being sold by the estate of the late cardiologist Leonardo Berezovsky.

item.title: Disneyland's Magic Kingdom under construction in Shanghai revealed in virtual tour
item.description: Dramatic new drone footage has revealed that work on Shanghai's spectacular new $5.5bn Disney resort is well underway. The park features Disney's biggest ever castle.

item.title: University of Minnesota athletics chief Norwood Teague resigns over drunken texts
item.description: The University of Minnesota's athletic director, Norwood Teague, resigned on Friday after admitting he drank too much at a recent event and sent 'inappropriate texts' to colleagues.

item.title: Cocoa motors reveal WalkCar, small enough to fit in a backpack
item.description: The $800 'WalkCar' is small enough to fit in a backpack, and has a top speed of 6.2 miles per hour. To steer, the user just shifts their weight.

item.title: Fox News GOP debate smashes viewership record as 10m tune in across America
item.description: Early Neilsen ratings suggest that Thursday night's debate not only set a new record for Republican primary debates, but had nearly double the viewers as the last record holder.
item.media:description: Republican presidential candidates arrive on stage for the Republican presidential debate on August 6, 2015 at the Quicken Loans Arena in Cleveland, Ohio. From left are: New Jersey Gov. Chris Christie; Florida Sen. Marco Rubio; retired neurosurgeon Ben Carson; Wisconsin Gov. Scott Walker; real estate magnate Donald Trump; former Florida Gov. Jeb Bush; former Arkansas Gov. Mike Huckabee; Texas Sen. Ted Cruz; Kentucky Sen. Rand Paul; and Ohio Gov. John Kasich. AFP PHOTO / MANDEL NGANMANDEL NGAN/AFP/Getty Images

item.title: Teen couple Dylan and Lexie survive lightning strike by holding hands
item.description: A doctor told Dylan and Lexie of Claremont, California that holding hands helped diffuse the electrical current that hit them.

item.title: 2 people get long jail sentences for insulting Thai monarchy on Facebook
item.description: A Thai man named Pongsak Sriboonpeng and a mother-of-two both had their prison terms halved for pleading guilty to insulting the country's monarch (King Bhumibol pictured)

item.title: SkyWest plane bursts into FLAMES at Nashville International Airport
item.description: The Delta-operated regional jet, carrying dozens of passengers, caught fire after the pilot turned on its engine while departing Nashville International Airport in Tennessee on Friday.

item.title: Boars WASH their food before eating it at Basel Zoo, Switzerland
item.description: When presented with grubby apples, a group of boars at Basel Zoo, Switzerland carry the treats to a river using their snouts and carefully wash them in the water.

item.title: Bangladeshi blogger Niloy Chatterjee hacked to death by Islamists in Dhaka
item.description: WARNING: GRAPHIC CONTENT. Suspected Islamists armed with machetes hacked a blogger to death in his home in Bangladesh today. Niloy Chatterjee used his blog to promote secularism

item.title: John McAfee arrested after driving high on Xanax with a gun in his car
item.description: McAfee, 69, was found driving erratically in Henderson County, Tennessee, on Sunday night and was found to be high on Xanax pills, which he claimed were a new prescription.
item.media:description:
John McAfee, an entrepreneur once associated with antivirus software and now associated with drugs and tropical murder accusations, is back in the news for illicit reasons. Police in his new home of Tennessee just busted McAfee for DUI and gun possession.
Caught on Tape: The Moment John McAfee Realized Vice Screwed Him Three years ago, Vice traveled to Central America to meet up with John McAfee, the antivirus& Read more internet.?gawker.?com According to The Jackson Sun, McAfee was ?arrested Sunday night by Tennessee Highway Patrol in Henderson County,? and ?charged with driving under the influence and possession of a handgun while intoxicated.? But because John McAfee is a volatile man, he took to Facebook to elaborate on the incident as only John McAfee can do

item.title: Mackeral attacks surfer who suffers broken cheek and dislocated jaw
item.description: A 27-year-old surfer fell from his board off the coast of Sao Vicente, Brazil, and suffered severe facial injuries. Surgeons removed the jaw of a white snake mackerel (pictured) from his nasal cavity.

item.title: Predators have vertical slits for pupils, while prey have 'letterbox' shaped holes
item.description: Scientists at the University of California at Berkeley studied the eyes of 214 land species to deduce that predators have differently shaped eyes to prey.

item.title: Super typhoon Soudelor to hit Taiwan and China with wind speeds of 100mph
item.description: Full force of Typhoon Soudelor is expected to hit Taiwan August 7 and 8. South eastern coast of China will also be affected by the tropical storm. 2,000 people have been evacuated and two died.

item.title: PIERS MORGAN: Yes, Donald Trump can be vicious, arrogant, obnoxious and even a little bit evil – which is exactly why a lot of people think he will make a bloody good President
item.description: Whether you love him or hate him, isn’t it fantastically refreshing to see someone stomping around the political arena who DOESN’T behave like a robotic, media-trained, timid little mouse?

item.title: Skysphere in Linton boasts 360-degree views and a beer dispenser in the couch
item.description: Plastics engineer Jono Williams, from Linton, New Zealand, spent $50,000 (£32,000) on materials and worked on the Skysphere for 3,000 hours after coming up with the idea over a few beers.

item.title: Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson and Facebook's Mark Zuckerberg hang out in Japan
item.description: Just like DeVito and Arnie, these guys make for unlikely pals.

item.title: Child porn suspect Alexander Carlsson 'admits being aroused by My Little Pony'
item.description: Alexander Carlsson, from Longwood, Florida, who was arrested this week for allegedly possessing child porn, has now told police he performs sex acts while watching My Little Pony, documents say.

item.title: Steve Jobs refused to pay Chrisann Brennan $25million she claims in letters
item.description: The late Apple founder rebuffed the mother of his eldest daughter, Chrisann Brennan, when she asked him to set up a trust fund for her as compensation for raising Lisa.

item.title: John Dee Weter 'beat girlfriend to death with a machete in front of her 2 kids'
item.description: John Dee Weter Jr, 31, was arrested in Montgomery County, Texas Thursday night after allegedly murdering his 33-year-old girlfriend, Michelle Becker.

item.title: Bigfoot sighting in North Carolina in Henderson County by Eric Walters and dog Zippy
item.description: A man from Boone vacationing near Asheville claims to have captured video of Sasquatch crossing the road in Henderson County. Eric Walters was walking his dog Zippy when he saw it.

item.title: Sumo wrestler Atilla Charles 'kidnapped woman and made his wife sexually assault her'
item.description: Atilla Charles, 35, was recently served an arrest warrant for an incident in 2010 when he allegedly rampaged through a San Antonio woman's home and held her while looking for her friend.

item.title: Is this a witch's skeleton? 1.4k-year-old bones unearthed at Rollright Stones
item.description: The remains were discovered near the Rollright Stones in Warwickshire, which legend has it were created when a witch turned a king and his knights to stone.

item.title: Inside Sonagachi, Asia's largest red light district with hundreds of brothels
item.description: The seedy world of Sonagachi, in the western city of Kolkata, is swamped with hundreds of multi-storey brothels, housing roughly 14,000 prostitutes who travel work here from all over India.

item.title: Was life on Earth jump-started by underwater volcanoes?
item.description: Scientists from Nasa's Jet Propulsion Laboratory in California have managed to power a light bulb using geothermal vents built in the lab that simulate conditions on the ocean floor when life first arose.

item.title: Was life on Earth jump-started by underwater volcanoes?
item.description: Scientists from Nasa's Jet Propulsion Laboratory in California have managed to power a light bulb using geothermal vents built in the lab that simulate conditions on the ocean floor when life first arose.

item.title: Illegal immigrant charged in Marilyn Pharis's rape and fatal beating
item.description: Victor Ramirez, 29, allegedly sexually assaulted and savagely beat Marilyn Pharis, 64, with a hammer after breaking into her Santa Maria, California, home on the morning of July 24.

item.title: Humans evolved large brains because our ancestors ate POTATOES
item.description: Researchers at the Autonomous University of Barcelona say starches would have been readily available to ancestral human populations in the form of potatoes, nuts and seeds.

item.title: Oregon railway inspector Josh Cyganik got 100 volunteers to repaint man's home
item.description: Track inspector Josh Cyganik rallied more than 100 friends and family to help him paint, and donate materials to make-over pensioner Leonard Bullock's home, in Pendleton, Oregon.

item.title: Ohio woman dies from Legionnaires' disease after 10th person passes away in NY
item.description: Elaine Stacer, 53, died at University Hospital in Cleveland yesterday morning from Legionnaires' disease as investigators try to work out how and where she was infected.
item.media:description:
PHOTO: Elaine Stacer (left)
A woman died in Cleveland from Legionnaires? disease on Thursday, health officials confirmed to newsnet5.com.
Our app users learned about this story first. Download our newsnet5 app here to stay up to date on breaking news.
Elaine Stacer, 53, of Brunswick, died Thursday morning at University Hospital, according to a spokesperson at the hospital and Cuyahoga County health officials.
Stacer was admitted to a different hospital on July 24. University Hospital said Stacer was very ill when she was brought to their hospital.
Family members told newsnet5.com Stacer was healthy prior to the infection.
Stacer also suffered a stroke after being diagnosed with Legionnaires? disease, University Hospital said.
Officials are not sure how Stacer contracted the disease yet.
NewsChannel5 Investigator Sarah Buduson spoke with a Cuyahoga County health official who said they will be working with health officials in Medina County to investigate Stacer's death.
The

item.title: Georgia prison escapee Willie Lee Austin on the lam for 34 YEARS caught
item.description: A man who escaped from a Georgia prison 34 years ago has finally been apprehended by federal authorities. Willie Lee Austin was arrested in Florida on Wednesday outside of his business.

item.title: Regina Dilworth tried to drown nine-month-old son because he was 'possessed'
item.description: Police say they don't know where that child would be today had the good Samaritan not circled back after seeing Regina Dilworth, pictured, from Idaho, walking in the road and intervened.

item.title: How being addicted to the internet could make you sick
item.description: Scientists at Swansea University found excessive internet use led to a lack of interaction with other people - and less time spent outside being exposed to immune-boosting germs.

item.title: World's best places to surf from Portugal's waves to Hawaii's pipeline
item.description: It charts how the biggest breaks compare to each other, with the 100ft monster waves at Nazare, Portugal, towering over the rest. The infographic explains that quality counts, too.

item.title: Botswana elephants enjoy drinking from a toilet rather than their water hole
item.description: Sneaking out for a quick call of nature, one camper got the surprise of her life when she came across an elephant drinking out of one of the campsite lavatories in Botswana.

item.title: How Chinese kids chomp their way through whole watermelons
item.description: In China, August 7 or occasionally August 8 marks the end of summer and the beginning of autumn. It's a date that's sometimes marked with a quirky food tradition called Ken Qiu.

item.title: Hundreds of balloons take off at start of Balloon Fiesta in Bristol
item.description: The 37th International Balloon Fiesta launched in Bristol with half a million visitors expected. Among the 103 balloons in the sky today was one of the largest Tibetan flags, which caused a stir ahead.

item.title: Saudi Arabia women surrounded by jeering men as they walk along promenade
item.description: In the minute-long video, the two young women - dressed in traditional burkhas and face veils - become visibly distressed as they are harassed and intimidated by the men.

item.title: Delta Airlines releases hilarious flight safety video featuring Moses
item.description: The video is narrated by a member of cabin staff from the American airline, complete with Cheshire Cat smile, with her instructions demonstrated by a related comedy scene.

item.title: Feel like you’re going to lose it? Six ways to stay calm when it all goes wrong at the office
item.description: Organizational psychologist Michael 'Dr Woody' Woodward has shared his insights into managing our emotions in high-stress situations.

item.title: MH370 investigators launch new search for debris around Reunion Island
item.description: MH370 investigators have pledged to launch new air, land and sea searches for debris around Reunion Island after a wing from the ill-fated plane washed up on its shores last week.

item.title: Amazon 'wooed Clarkson, Hammond and May for 'Top Gear' show with £160M budget'
item.description: Andy Wilman, a former Top Gear producer who is jumping ship with the trio, revealed it was the eye-watering budget Amazon offered that secured the team.

item.title: Essex woman who faints up to six times a DAY but has escaped injury
item.description: Jordan Marshall, from Essex, suffers from Vasovagal Syncope. She fears her unusual condition will mean she may never be a mother due to the risk of her fainting and crushing the baby.

item.title: Chongqing guest house listed for demolition remains open
item.description: Hotel is situated in the South Bank district of Chongqing, south west China. Negotiation for the demolition compensation haven't been finalised yet to owners have decided to keep hotel open.

item.title: The foods that will give you a radiant glow in under a WEEK
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Nutritionist Fiona Kirk has devised a Super Skin Diet which she recommends following for 3 to 7 days before and/or after your long-awaited summer break for a glowing complexion.
